text.p: Turkish champions Fenerbahce are to sell their international defender Bulent Uygun for "over-emotional" and undisciplined behaviour, club officials said.

"Bulent is to be sold because he behaved emotionally towards (former Fenerbahce veteran) Oguz in the Istanbulspor match and because he argued with coach (Sebastiao) Lazaroni before the Rapid Vienna match," the club said in a statement on Sunday.

Turkish international Oguz Cetin, well respected among his former Fenerbahce colleagues, was sold to rival Istanbulspor last year despite protests from the club's players and fans. Fenerbahce, who drew 1-1 against Istanbulspor last weekend, said Uygun had not played rigorously enough to block Cetin.
"The executive committee has decided unanimously that Bulent must be sold. We are assessing all offers from home and abroad," Fenerbahce spokesman Orhan Keceli told reporters.
He did not say how much they expected to sell the defender for. Fenerbahce beat Rapid Vienna in Istanbul last week to go second in their European Champions' League group ahead of Manchester United.
